newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-BECKER TO DEFEND AUSTRALIAN OPEN TITLE.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-BECKER TO DEFEND AUSTRALIAN OPEN TITLE.

text.p: Boris Becker plans to defend his Australian Open title in January despite an ankle injury sustained in training recently that forced him to withdrawal from a tournament in Qatar next week.
Becker was quoted in Bild newspaper on Saturday saying he fully intends to play in the Australian Open in Melbourne, which starts on January 13.
"Provided nothing unexpected happens, I will play," Becker said.

Becker's win in Melbourne in January was the first grand slam tournament the 29-year-old had won in five years. He was forced out of the French Open with a pulled muscle and an agonising wrist injury forced him to abandon Wimbledon mid-match in the third round.
But he finished the year strongly, reaching the final of the ATP Championship where he lost narrowly to Pete Sampras in five sets, then winning the Grand Slam Cup in impressive fashion.
